text: LIVE COVERAGE | CONCLUDED Last Updated: Jan. 18, 2024 at 6:44 PM EST 2 months ago By Karishma Vanjani Chip stocks were having a great day, with graphics processor manufacturer Nvidia set to hit a milestone on its growth. The iShares Semiconductor exchange-traded fund was up 3% on Thursday. Its top two holdings Advanced Micro Devices and Nvidia were up 1.5% and 2.4%, respectively. Nvidia was on pace to close with a market capitalization greater than $1.4 trillion for the first time on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data. The cheer within the sector stems from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing's bullish outlook on revenue growth. That bodes well for the industry as TSMC is a key supplier for U.S. chip makers. iShares Semiconductor ETF SOXX (U.S.: Nasdaq) NVIDIA Corp. NVDA (U.S.: Nasdaq) Advanced Micro Devices Inc.
